data: Claude Debussy was a French composer who lived from 1862 to 1918. He was a child prodigy who began composing music at the age of six. He studied at the Paris Conservatory and won the Prix de Rome in 1884. He was a member of the Symbolist movement and his music was known for its use of unusual harmonies and textures. He composed a number of influential works, including "La Mer" and "Pelléas and Mélisande." He died in 1918 of cancer.
